column4: It sounds like your package manager failed to download the archive list, sometimes it gives that warning if that happens.  Can you run sudo apt-get update in a terminal and see if you get any errors?
its showing errors
Can you pastebin them?
Did you just add medibuntu to your sources?
Yes, skype is in the medibuntu repos, you didn't add their gpg key as well.  This will do that: wget -q http://packages.medibuntu.org/medibuntu-key.gpg -O- | sudo apt-key add -
No.. please run the command I just gave you.
Now run sudo apt-get update again
OK
Now you can do whatever you needed to do in the first place.
The warning won't come up now, we just fixed that.
Too much free time ;)
Do you remember the code that you used from the forums to get skype?
So you already have skype installed, you're just doing regular updates?
Can you run: sudo apt-get upgrade    in a terminal and tell me if you get that same error, if so please use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste it.
I know.
give me the link that it created.
Please close update-manager and then run it that command again.
Great, can you pastebin that? Or just paste here the code that it says, somethimg like NEED PUBKEY BLEHH
Sorry, my brain is wonky tonight.  Can you run sudo apt-get update again and tell me if you get an error again?
It means that it failed to contact the repository to double check that the update was genuine. You can either ignore it (and continue with the update) or I could remember how to fix it.
Doesn't really matter.  The next time around it'll probably download the package list properly and you won't get an error.
I mean when another skype update comes out.  And if you do get the error, feel free to poke me here, I'm always around.
shouldn't be.
